title: Excellent sync with zotero,  sony z1 and samsung one note 10.1
comment: Totally happy for having a reference manager app . Still improvements to be done, keep on the good work.

title: Basic, but functional
comment: It works well for the basics, but i would love to see support for group libraries. As it is, it covers my own research, but I'd love it to work for my collabs as well.

title: Very Useful App - One, hopefully fixable, problem
comment: Very Helpful on the whole I use this app frequently, both on my Blackberry Passport and on my Samsung Note 8. It syncs well with my Zotero references. My only concern is that I am unable to enter new references using ISBN numbers. When I enter the ISBN number using the "add by identifer" command. the app seems to go into an infinite loop and never adds the requested information. This happens both on the Passport and the Note 8. This severely limits its utility for mobile use in libraries, bookstores, etc. If this problem is fixed, I would give it 5 stars.

title: Not good!
comment: The app is not updated on weeks or at least monthly basis! It s impossible to synchronise with WEBDAV servers, poor UI (very hard to find papers or to navigate in subfolder). In conclusion, my suggestion is to not buy it: unfortunately, this project is far away from zotero desktop and, for this reason, It is useless.

title: Bad UI and bad features
comment: I am hoping that the developer will soon understand why so many users are frustrated with this app. This being the only Zotero app for Android, the app has huge market, if developed well.

title: Good Idea.
comment: At first I gave a low score because I couldn't add content, just view. After being informed that I must be doing something wrong, I realized that some things can be added on the go. But - and I may just be technologically deficient, as this is my first smart phone - I can only add material to an existing folder already created in the full Zotero program. I cannot seem to use the app to start a new line of research from scratch.   It is a very good idea. And I hope that the app is expanded - even if what is needed is user education.
You can actually create items on the go, and add notes to existing items.

title: Only option for Zotero and not a solid one
comment: The app works somewhat but it is very, very clunky. User interface is unintuitive. I still don't get how sync works as some collections show items within them and some dont. Bottom line - requires a lot of improvements before this app can be ready for primetime. This aint no papership like available for ios.
To open a view of subcollections, long-tap a collection.

title: Solid Zotero library app for Android
comment: Downloaded this so I can coordinate my reading and sync my Zotero library when "on the go" while toting my Android tablet. I use webdav on my personal server space to store my files. It does everything I need it to do: stay synced with my online Zotero library and provide me the pdfs from my webdav space when I need them. Thanks Avram!

title: Not good enough
comment: Have had problems syncing (no automatic sync) and it is impossible to open files via the webdav function (How does one do it?). Without this I think this app is not suitable for research; I organise all my working papers on Zotero and use a webdav cloud to sync everything. I would love a papership type app in my device, that would let me access and read the files. Android is behind ios in terms of research tools. Zandy is going in the right direction, but is not quite there yet (look at papership for good ideas!). Hope this is changed soon, I am willing to reconsider my review if this changes. The interface could also be a bit more polished and offer a white background possibility. (also, smart searches and tagging support would be welcome)

title: Works, but no shared libraries
comment: Most of my important references lie in shared libraries; unfortunately they don't show up in the app.

title: Solid mobile Zotero app with reliable sync
comment: Given the relatively low overall reviews, I hesitated to pay for and download this app.  Now that I have, I have nothing but good things to say about it.  Apart from a somewhat uninspiring UI, it does what it claims to do and does it very well, at least for me.  I have had absolutely no sign-in problems and the sync has been flawless so far.  I can't say the same for seemingly more popular and less functional (though prettier) reference manager apps out there.  A refresh to the UI would get things to five stars, but I am still going to make very good use of this until then!.  Well done, Avram!

title: No group libraries support.
comment: No support for group libraries -- this isn't mentioned anywhere in the documentation. Completely useless to me without this functionality. I want my money back.
I've refunded your purchase. Sorry to see it didn't do what you needed.

title: Promising
comment: WebDav downloading/unzipping is slow sync may give duplicated items Modified attachments not uploaded
Newest version has much faster download and unzipping. Attachment modification is not yet something Zandy can do.

title: Did not work and still charges me
comment: What can I say? 2 dollars every month for probably unknown amount of time for no support.
$2 was a one-time price. I've refunded your order.

Promising. WebDAV works after some wrestling (but not with http digest auth, alas--and attachment viewing takes a lot of clicks (3) and download time (compared to downloading in a browser)). I look forward to reading papers on this.

title: Disappointing
comment: Doesn't show sync progress or history. Attachments must be downloaded manually one by one. No search. Poor interface.  Zotero is great and easy whereas Zandy is disappointing.

title: Had its day, use others.
comment: Dev has left this to wallow for far too long. BibTex-based apps are the way to go, still keeping Zotero - check out Eratosthenes, autozotbib and zotero-better-bibtex.
You should be able to tap the abstract to see the rest of it -- but I'm still working on this and other navigation details.

title: It's good, but needs to let the user know what's going on
comment: I'm very happy to have Zandy, and it does work. I'd give it 5 stars, except for:  -What's going on when it's syncing? It pops up a little box, briefly, when syncing starts, and then when it's over. But I'd rather not sit there waiting for it. Zandy doesn't seem to handle the WiFi arrow very well, so that's a very unreliable way to tell if Zandy is busy or not.  -Attachment downloading confusion: Zandy seems to start downloading another copy of an attachment when my tablet (Lenovo S6000) dims the screen, when I go to another app, or just kind of at random. There will be multiple download message boxes for the same item alternating with each other. Again, it's impossible to figure out what's going on.  -Won't see attachments without parent items: This is just kind of annoying, but as far as I can tell if you have a file -- PDF, say -- that you've put in Zotero without yet creating a parent item, Zandy can't find it.

title: Works well,  only thing...
comment: It would be nice if there was support for group collections

title: Bad download feature
comment: Please,  fix this feature to enable box integration.  Without  that the app is useless..

title: Good so far
comment: The app does a great job at pulling up my zotero information. I have not added anything to my account yet using zandy. I do have some suggestions. A sort feature would be nice to sort by date added, title, maybe author. An icon to indicate if there is an attachment to the reference item. Long press to copy information to clipboard, email reference info, export item, maybe generate citation.  Look forward to updates.

title: Works great on my crappy wal-mart phone and nook color
comment: Sync works well and I can (eventually) find what I'm looking for. Not the most user friendly. I think if I used categories more on my Zotero then Zandy would be friendlier!
It keeps asking for login and key, even tho I was successful each time	Can't get past login and key stage in order to get my collection.
Thanks for the feedback-- we can simplify the key process to make this work more reliably, and I'll make sure to get that into the next update.

title: Definitely worth the purchase
comment: After being at first put off by the negative reviews, but seeing that it's getting regular updates and feedback from the developer, I decided to try the app. For now I'll mostly be using it for the WebDAV file attachment retrieval because the UI is still rudimentary. Some suggestions to mirror what has been said before : (1) a quicker way to access the attachment (an icon on the far right side for example). (2) integration with a pdf reader app after download completes (just an option to choose an app or at least to go to the folder where the file is stored). Keep up the good work.

title: Doesn't work on GT
comment: Crashes on log-in, 'sync error' when API number is entered manually. I didn't receive help from the developers within three days. Requesting a refund. Android 2.2., Samsung GT P1000  The latest update didn't solve anything
Try again with the latest version, 1.4.0. The crash on login in some cases in resolved and you should be able to get going now. If you needed a refund, please email me again and I'll get it to you.

title: Works
comment: The app works. I can access my online synced library and via webdav also the pdfs that are attached. I had to set the API keys manually as the link from the browser back to zandy did not work. The app itself could be a bit better. For one, the number of clicks to get to the pdf's is too many. Also a link back to the library (e.g. via the logo in the top-left) would be helpful to reduce the number of back-back-back clicks.

title: Does what I need
comment: This is seeming to do what I need which is to be able to work in zotero without having to be in front of my computer, just using my tablet.  I am a doctoral student, and a mom of three little kids, and reading new sources constantly.  This allows me to file new articles, and open read, highlight and make notes about an article and enter it directly into zotero from my tablet. And be at the park with my kids at the same time.  Perfect.

title: Horrible
comment: Don't waste your time. Doesn't sync all my collections. Not worth downloading if it were free. Horrendous UI

title: Need improvements
comment: I bought the application just to support the developer. Unfortunately,  the application is minimal in its current status and needs a big improvement to be really useful. After opening some attachments,  I get unsupported format message although they are usual PDFs. * update: I can now open the PDF files after resetting my application handlers. However,  Zandy still needs more development to be a mature application.

title: Rounds out utility of zotero
comment: Not flashy but it works consistently for me.  I second other users comments that it can be annoying to navigate. Easy to set up and definitely helps me out.  Three thoughts on improvements. 1. Indicate downloaded files in collection menu, and allow access to documents there (either local or request download). 2. Functionality to delete local files from the program.  3.  Integration with a reader.  Thanks!

title: Tedious
comment: "Aggressive sync" doesn't work. You have to sync each collection individually. Tedious. I paid for this a long time ago and it still barely works.

title: Need to recognize subcollection
comment: Not at the level I would use regularly yet.

title: Can't open
comment: Force closes at login.   4 .3. Problem?  Too bad.   1 star only because I'd really like it to run
The crash hitting some people on login is now resolved. Download 1.4.0 and try again! If you still have trouble, post your issue at http://gimranov.com/forum.

title: Misses the point
comment: There is some ongoing error which is preventing downloading of pdfs from your storage. So why get this app? I'm not trying to access my zotero library on my tablet to admire all my citations. I want to lie down and read a scientific paper. This app is the kind of frustration that makes me wish I just had a regular OS on tablets, and didn't have to waste time with bad apps
The most recent updates have resolved most known issues with PDF downloading; I encourage you to try again.

title: Promising but useless
comment: I purchased the app in a hope to support the developer despite the low reputation of the product. After a good deal of attempts to get used to the interface and the behavior of the app I had to give up because it lacks even the basic functionality to make it useful. Unreliable and uncontrollable syncs. Multiple instances of the same record made in Zandy keep reappearing in Zotero after being deleted. No search. Awkward navigation...

title: Unstable
comment: Works well on my S2 but chrashes after first log in on my Galaxy Tab2 10.1. Just says it as stopped running. Please fix and I will rate again.
The crash hitting some people on login is now resolved. Download 1.4.0 and try again! If you still have trouble, post your issue at http://gimranov.com/forum.

title: Login does not work in Nexus 4
comment: The app uses the web browser for the login. After authorization of the application keys, the url loaded does not go back to the app, so the log in never completes.   Please fix!

title: Awesome
comment: I was ready to share, open and read on my cellphone and tablet all my scientific library in just 2 min from installing Zandy.... exactly what I needed.

title: Notes not showing full detail as stored on zotero
comment: A waste without these for serious research.
Long tap on the note to see it in its entirety. That said, people on tablets should get a proper detail view; I'm working now on what that will be.

title: Excellent app
comment: Does everything I need it to. I don't use it to sync pdfs - I do that using Google Drive instead. Great effort from a third party developer. Much appreciated!

title: seems to work... after some tinkering
comment: I like zotero and have used it for several years now. The app itself is far from perfect, the UI seems to be optimized for smaller screens (I'm using a 7inch tablet), but after some tinkering (see below) it does what I want it to do: it allows me to browse my library and read the papers on the tablet.  When I first installed the app, I was rather disappointed.  I use zotero for a while now and use private WebDAV space to store the documents. My main hope was that I could use the app to read those documents on the tablet, but even though the app offered a setting to put in WebDAV login data, I was not able to access it. But after some looking around, I found a solution: I used a self-certified SSL key for my web space, and hence the connection was refused by Android itself. The problem can be solved in several ways: use non-encrypted connections (maybe not so great), use "officially certified" keys, use the storage solution offerend by zotero itself (at least I assume this will work) or (what I did) import the certificate used into Android (also I'm not sure if this works with all Android version) as trusted CA certificate.
Useful app!

title: Can not download attachment
comment: This is the key function I hope to have....
The identified issues with attachment downloading have been resolved in the latest versions, if you want to try again.

title: Understand the developer's situation
comment: This is a way for the developer to fund an open source project for a very useful, but still niche project. Have I figured out how to read attachments? No. Does syncing work properly on my very large library? No. But, it's a start, and you can always try to make it better yourself! Xemacs comes to mind here...

title: Waste of money, just crashes
comment: I started up Zandy and tapped on Log In. That opened my browser where I logged in to Zotero and chose to authorize Zandy with its default permissions. It then automatically switched back to Zandy, which showed just a blank screen, then crashed.  This happens consistently.

title: Sync issues
comment: Everything keeps disappearing in my collections, only showing folders but all empty. Happening on my phone and tablet. Useless

title: Excellent app - mobile Zotero
comment: Now that the downloading of file attachments functions properly this app is the perfect mobile companion for Zotero.

title: Just need to upload files back to Zotero
comment: This is a great app. Once this is capable of uploading files back to Zotero after comments and highlighting I will be even happier with this software.  I would also like to have the ability to add content similar to how I do in Firefox on the desktop (one click from the browser) but it is much less important to me than uploading files back.

title: Great app
comment: Update: with the most recent version attachment download works, which makes Zandy a very use full app to have, if you use Zotero.    Original review: In a way zandy is a great app because it lets me access all my references from zotero. But the viewing and download of attachments doesn't seem to work properly yet, which greatly limits its usefulness for me. Once the attachments work, I would probably rate it 4 stars.

title: So close, getting there
comment: Gives basic collection browsing, worth the $4 because the Zotero web site is so mobile unfriendly. Hope the developer can further the development.

title: CAUTION: THIS APP IS NOT MAINTAINED ANYMORE!
comment: I bought Zandy 2 weeks ago and it doesn't work on my Xoom tablet. I wrote several mails to the developer but he never replied.  That's a pity because I bought the app primarily to support him. Otherwise the code is available opensource on Google code, and you can compile it yourself (with some little technical skills). I would encourage anyone interested in Zandy to go that way, as buying an app which nobody maintains makes you feel like just an idiot...

title: the app does not work at all
comment: never able to login. no communication with service provider

title: Works fine in ICS.
comment: Haven't tried attachment syncing, but the quick and easy access to my library is much better than the website. It does take quite a while to sync,  though.

title: Attachment syncing over WebDAV not working
comment: I bought this app to keep a copy of my library on the go. Unfortunately,  the app's attachment syncing feature appears to be broken: none of the attachments are downloaded from my library. The author does not respond to questions on App's forum. If attachment syncing is important to you, don't waste your money.

title: needed application
comment: nice idea, but downloading attachments is not working, which is the most important feature for me, for reading on my tablet. the interface is not easy to use either. the idea is very good and such an app is welcome.

title: Ok...not great.
comment: I would like it more if it would sync my noted better. I was wishing I hadn't bought it seeing that i can go online and access all the stuff that I get through this app.  I am wishing it had a separate button for notes under a citation.  The reason I sue Zotero is to keep my note with my book database.  Zandy doesn't have a simple interface like zotero.

title: Make citations
comment: I hope some kind of tool for create bibliography from a selected items, to paste it in an office program.

title: Close, so close
comment: Let me search by tags and you'll have one very satisfied customer.

title: Value for money?
comment: For an app that is relatively expensive this software provides minimal benefit .
Very promising but problems with syncing: seems to maax out at multiples of 50 items, and no attachments :(  (htc hero-gingerbread and rooted nook)

title: Not much functionality.
comment: Good start but search feature is poor and does not find all refs that it should.  Can't view all tags, sort by date added, or reduce font size.

title: Great app.
comment: A great that is getting updated on a high frequency. A must-have for bibliography management. And it's getting better and better.

title: getting better and better
comment: Great new version of Zandy. The new features increases its utility greatly. Even the not completely integrated features are very well thought out. Being able to add items directly from another app is invaluable. As the release note says, the site translators are not integrated yet but these new items are tagged as 'added by Zandy'. So it is very easy to find them later on and modify them of needed. Great to see Zotero getting more and more mobile life through Zandy.
